text: “She had repaid his kindness with kindness. As she would not have done if she had known who he was. What he was.” An excerpt from Marilynne Robinson’s forthcoming novel, the fourth book in her Gilead series. https://t.co/6Vhqgo7Q5o

text: A new documentary shows the tense months leading up to the felony trial of Scott Warren, who was prosecuted for bringing water to migrants in the desert—an “attempt to criminalize basic human kindness,” Warren said. https://t.co/r0RrDPJ4T2

text: Greek and Roman statues were often painted, but assumptions about race and aesthetics have suppressed this truth. Now scholars are making a color correction. https://t.co/OpIxNU2cHL

text: A highly contagious illness called rabbit hemorrhagic disease is poised to become endemic in the United States. The vaccines that might stop it are caught up in the contradictions of the creatures. https://t.co/BCoNuw6yIm

text: Ernest Hemingway was a writer who “made the English language new, changed the rhythms of the way both his own and the next few generations would speak and write and think,” Joan Didion writes. #NewYorkerArchive https://t.co/Lk6T1ztw5o

name: NewYorker
text: One secret of Kate Bush’s artistry is that she has never feared the ludicrous—she tries things that other musicians would be too careful or cool to go near. https://t.co/MLfvCsKKvN

text: The debate between the 20th century’s leading black intellectual and a man who used phrenology to argue for the superiority of the "Nordic race" went exactly as you might expect. https://t.co/r7JU0sSufe
